lead_paragraph: The steamboat train of the Boston and Providence Railroad came in contact with an ox, near Dodgeville, last Saturday evening, at 61/2 o'clock. The front wheels of the locomotive were knocked off, and with the ox carried under theo last passenger car, which was the only one that remained on the track. The others, with the locomotive, were thrown off.
